title: The Grudge = Ju-on (2003)
creator_credit: Takashi Shimizu, Takashige Ichise, Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha and Aozora Investment
brief_description: Suitably scary J-horror that draws appealingly on the tropes of the genre with disgruntled spirits rising to haunt the terrified living. When a young social worker helps out an elderly woman, she finds a young boy residing in a spooky house. Each investigating person becomes troubled by menacing spirits, until a detective attempts to destroy the house. Aping the very successful style of “The Ring” (Hideo Nakata, 1998), Takashi Shimizu engages in elliptical narrative threads, whilst providing requisite scares and thrills. This film is a big-screen re-working of “Ju-on” and “Ju-on 2” two low budget Shimizu films. Cast includes: Megumi Okina, Misaki Ito, Kanji Tsuda, Shuri Matsuda, and Misa Uehara.

constellations_other.name: Houses that move us
constellations_other.description: Our homes are important to us. When they’re good, they’re our havens. If that home changes, or things go wrong, it can affect us very deeply. This constellation looks at the different ways directors and game devs have positioned the home onscreen - from sanctuary, to hostile enemy.
